column1: #Text=Prior to your involvement in the Beck v. Eiland-Hall case , what related legal experience have you had specifically related to the legal concepts of the case ?
#Text=: I am both a First Amendment lawyer and an intellectual property lawyer .
#Text=I practice in these areas , write on those areas , and taught them at the law school level .
#Text=Given that these are my areas of expertise , this case was directly in my strike zone .
#Text=Why did you agree to represent Isaac Eiland-Hall ?
#Text=When one citizen 's constitutional rights are threatened , all of our rights are threatened , and I 'm not letting that happen on my watch .
#Text=: I took this case because of my sense of patriotism demanded it , as did my feelings about maintaining good karma .
#Text=I became a First Amendment lawyer because I believe deeply in the Constitution .

#Text=As my career has gone on , I 've seen that often wealthy and powerful people are awfully thin skinned about criticism , and they use their money and power to attempt to silence " the little guy .

#Text=You wrote in the conclusion to the Eiland-Hall response brief ,  there can be only one purpose to filing this complaint : as an attempt to silence a critic because he does n't like being criticized .
